intro: Bidens peucedanifolia, commonly known as the Mexican ironweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers are typically yellow with dark centers, and it produces small, elliptical fruits called cypselae. Bidens peucedanifolia is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
